III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Sometime before 12/9/24, a youth was pulled by their ankle and/or
held by their ankle during a restraint.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on January 16,
2025, and reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Youth A described a couple of months ago
Staff 3 and another female staff dragged Youth A by her ankle and
wrist down the hallway by the bedrooms. Youth A reported she
tried to go to her bedroom and that was when she was dragged.
Youth A stated she could not recall how she ended up on the floor
for Staff 3 and another female staff to hold her ankle and wrist.
Youth A denied being in a restraint. Youth A denied other youth
being present. Youth A reported this was the only time she was
dragged by staff. Youth A stated she could not recall the details
because it was a long time ago. Youth A reported Staff 1 pushed
her outside the school door yesterday and would not allow her
back into the school. Youth A stated she ran into the woods and
sat down for about 15 minutes before coming back to the school.
Youth A denied any staff looking for her or following her out of the
building.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Youth B denied ever seeing any staff drag any
youth by their ankle and/or wrist or hearing something like this
ever took place. Youth B stated she did not see Youth A get
pushed out the school door yesterday. Youth B reported Youth A
was in class all day yesterday.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Youth C denied seeing Youth A dragged by
her ankle and wrist by staff. Youth C reported she has never seen
any staff drag a youth. Youth C reported Staff 1 pushed Youth A
out the door yesterday for disrupting school. Youth C stated Staff
1 used two hands to push Youth A. Youth C described Youth A
being pushed out the door at the school, then stated it was the
door in the administration building and later stated it was the door
by Director of Residential Service’s office. Youth C stated she
was with Staff 3 in the hallway by Residential Service’s office
when she saw Staff 1 push Youth A out the door. Youth C
2

reported this was the first time she ever saw any staff push a
youth.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Youth D denied ever seeing any staff drag
Youth A by her ankle and wrist. Youth D stated Youth A is
“always having her freakouts” trying to assault staff and youth.
Youth D reported staff step in and separate Youth A from the
group or the group separates from Youth A. Youth D stated it is
hard living with Youth A. Youth D denied being concerned with
any interactions between staff and Youth A. Youth D denied
seeing Youth A get pushed by any staff out a door at school or
from any building. Youth D stated Youth A was in school all day
yesterday. Youth D described Staff 1 being a “good guy.”
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Supervisor denied seeing or being aware of
Youth A being dragged down the hall by her ankle and wrist by
staff. Supervisor reported she did not have any concerns with
Staff 3’s interactions with Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
21, 2025. Staff 1 denied pushing Youth A out any door at any
time. Staff 1 reported Youth A left the classroom yesterday but
never left the building.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on January 23, 2025.
Staff 2 reported when he was employed, he never saw any staff
drag a youth. Staff 2 denied any youth expressed concerns to him
of being dragged by staff.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
12, 2025. Staff 3 described a situation where Youth A was on the
floor and had her legs wrapped around Staff 3 and Staff 3 moved
Youth A’s legs from entangling Staff 3’s legs. Staff 3 denied
grabbing Youth A’s ankles, legs or wrists and dragging Youth A.
Staff 3 stated Staff 5 helped with Youth A during this situation.
Staff 3 reported this is the only situation she could recall where
she moved Youth A’s legs.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
12, 2025. Staff 5 described an incident where Youth A was laying
on the floor upset over popcorn. Staff 5 reported Youth A had her
legs wrapped around Staff 3 who was standing next to Youth A.
Staff 5 stated Staff 3 bent down and moved Youth A’s legs from
being around her then stepped back away from Youth A. Staff 5
3

denied Staff 3 grabbed and dragged Youth A by any part of Youth
A’s body. Staff 5 denied seeing any staff drag Youth A or any
youth.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 1/20/25 in the hallways of the school was
reviewed on 1/21/2025. Youth A is seen walking the school
hallways. Staff 1 is seen in a different hallway not near Youth A.
At no point in the video is Youth A seen going out the door leaving
the school building or being pushed by Staff 1.
Video of Youth A allegedly being dragged by staff was not
reviewed as the camera system only goes back 30 days and the
timeframe reported was sometime prior to 12/09/24. The
allegations were reported on 1/16/25.
Tour Observation:
It should be noted when standing by Residential Service’s office
one cannot see the door where Youth C reported seeing Youth A
be pushed out.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record for
Staff 1 and Staff 1 completed Aegis training on 4/11/2024.
• Staff 3’s personnel file: There were two disciplinary action
forms in Staff 3’s file not related to interactions with youth.
Staff 3 completed Aegis training on 4/11/2024.
• Eagle Village Staff Code of Conduct Policy. Policy outlines
staff will treat residents and coworkers with respect and
dignity in words and action. All staff will strive to be
professional in the behavior, conversation and all
interactions with others.
• Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating
Procedures. Operating Procedures state, “It is the intent of
Eagle Village to treat all residents with dignity and respect,
even when the resident is being disruptive or inappropriate.
For this reason, some forms of behavior management are
deemed inappropriate and are not approved. Any staff
member found using unacceptable behavior management
practices will immediately be subject to disciplinary action
up to termination.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff, Youth B, Youth C,
and Youth D interviews Youth A was not dragged by staff. Video
review as well as staff and youth interviews do not show or
indicate Staff 1 pushed Youth A out a door.
4

Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The youth was called a derogatory name by staff.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Youth A reported Staff 7 called her a “bitch.”
This was investigated in 2025SIC0000229. Youth A stated Staff 2
called her a “nigger” about four months ago when they were in the
woods. Youth A stated there were no other youth or staff around
when Staff 2 called her this. Youth A reported she could not recall
what was happening when this occurred. Youth A stated she told
Supervisor what Staff 2 said to her. Youth A reported this was the
only time Staff 2 called her a “nigger.” Youth A stated Staff 2 no
longer works at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Youth B denied hearing any staff call Youth A
or any youth a “bitch”. Youth B described Staff 3 as strict and
“putting boundaries on things”. Youth B denied ever hearing Staff
1 call any youth a “nigger”. Youth B reported she never heard
Staff 1 say anything “bad”.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Youth C described Staff 1 telling her she was
not worth anything and that Staff 1 hated her. Youth C denied any
youth or staff being around when Staff 1 made these statements.
Youth C could not recall when or where Youth C and Staff 1 were
when the statements were made. Youth C denied ever telling
anyone Staff 1 made these statements to her. Youth C stated she
never heard Staff 1 swear or call any youth a “nigger”.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Youth D reported she was not living at the
facility when Staff 1 was employed. Youth D denied hearing any
5

of the youth make statements about Staff 1 calling any of the
youth names or making inappropriate remarks.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Supervisor reported she did not work with
Staff 1 when Staff 1 was employed. Supervisor denied any youth
expressing concerns to her about Staff 1. Supervisor denied
Youth A ever told her that Staff 1 called Youth A a “nigger”.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on January 23, 2025.
Staff 2 reported he has not worked at the facility for the past few
months. Staff 2 denied calling Youth A or any youth a “nigger”.
Staff 2 stated Youth A often called him a “nigger”. Staff 2 denied
ever telling a youth they were not worth anything or that he hated
them. Staff 2 reported he knows the environment the youth come
from and would never say anything like that to youth. Staff 2
stated he could not recall Youth C.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
12, 2025. Staff 3 reported she heard Staff 6 call Youth A a
“psycho bitch.” Staff 3 stated Supervisor 2 was present when
Staff 3 made the statement. Staff 3 described being in the staff
office and talking with Supervisor 2 about Staff 6’s statement.
Staff 3 reported this happened in March or April of 2024.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
12, 2025. Staff 4 denied hearing any staff call Youth A or any
youth a “bitch” or “nigger”. Staff 4 reported no youth have
expressed any concerns to her about being called names or being
told staff hate them.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
12, 2025. Staff 5 denied hearing any staff call Youth A or any
youth a “bitch” or “nigger”. Staff 5 reported no youth have
expressed any concerns to her about being called names or being
told staff hate them.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via telephone on February 13,
2025. Supervisor 2 denied hearing Staff 6 call Youth A a “psycho
bitch”. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 3 never talked to her about
Staff 6 making that statement to Youth A.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on March 3, 2025. Staff
6 denied calling Youth A or any youth a “psycho bitch”. Staff 6
stated she never heard any staff call any of the youth names or
make inappropriate statements to the youth. Staff 6 reported she
6

worked at the facility for two years and “loved working with the
youth.”
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Staff Code of Conduct Policy. Policy outlines
staff will treat residents and coworkers with respect and
dignity in words and action. All staff will strive to be
professional in the behavior, conversation and all
interactions with others.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Youth A, Youth C and Staff 3
are the only individuals reporting youth were called derogatory
names. Youth B, Youth D, Supervisor, Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 4,
Staff 5, Supervisor 2, and Staff 6 all denied staff using derogatory
language or calling youth names at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: An investigation into allegations of physical abuse and verbal abuse at Eagle Village, a child caring institution, found the claims to be unsubstantiated. The report examined claims that a youth was dragged by staff and that staff used racial slurs and derogatory language, but witness accounts were contradictory, video evidence was unavailable or did not support the claims, and the facility's documented policies were deemed adequate. Ultimately, the state investigator concluded the facility was in compliance with all rules, placing responsibility for the unproven allegations on inconsistent and uncorroborated reporting rather than on the facility or its staff.
